page.title: 03PAULTONS COUNTRY PARK
page.content: The public park, opened in 1983, opens on most days. The house is private. Inside the grounds are lakes, rivers, museums and many rare animals. There are two weirs, the old one is on private grounds. The purpose of the weirs is to keep the water in the lake level. You can get to the new weir by walking through the grounds. The saw mill (powered by water) was built in l860, it still works but is not used. The lake is filled from Cadnam river and the storm drains of the M27. The lake is 200 years old. The land is very well cared for. There are village life displays showing people's old jobs, dairying carpentry etc. There is also a Romany village which consists of gypsy wagons.
